products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-ocp-ai
products.label: [Add-ons Beta] Cloud automation for Red Hat OpenShift AI
products.short_description: Deploy Red Hat OpenShift cluster on Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) pre-configured with AI capabilities for accelerated machine learning workloads.
products.long_description: This automation streamlines the deployment of Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud with the OpenShift AI add-on. It accelerates the setup of machine learning environments by leveraging the capabilities of the OpenShift AI add-on with GPU-enabled clusters, reducing the complexity of AI infrastructure management and allowing data scientists and developers to focus on model development and deployment. Learn more about [Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-getting-started) and the [OpenShift AI add-on](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-ai-addon-about). Refer [here](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/containers?topic=containers-supported-cluster-addon-versions#openshift-ai-416) for the supported OpenShift AI add-on versions.

features.title: Red Hat OpenShift Cluster
features.description: Creates and configures a GPU-enabled Red Hat OpenShift cluster on a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) to enable the installation of the OpenShift AI Add-on for integrating advanced artificial intelligence capabilities. [Learn more.](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-cluster-create-vpc-gen2&interface=ui)

features.title: OpenShift AI Add-on
features.description: Automates the provisioning of an OpenShift AI add-on on the Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud. This includes optimized configurations for machine learning frameworks and simplified deployment of AI-driven applications. Refer [here](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-ai-addon-install&interface=ui) to learn the service and its capabilities.

features.title: Virtual Private Cloud
features.description: Creates and configures a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network on IBM Cloud for deploying the OpenShift AI cluster in a secure and isolated network environment. [Learn more.](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-getting-started&interface=cli#create-and-configure-vpc)

features.title: Optional Integrations
features.description: This deployable architecture can  be integrated with [Cloud Object Storage (COS)](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-storage-cos-understand&interface=ui), [Secrets Manager (SM)](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-secrets-mgr), [Observability](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-logging) and [Key Management Services (KMS)](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-encryption-setup).

products.support_details: This product is in the community registry, as such support is handled through the originated repo. If you experience issues kindly open an issue [here](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-ocp-ai/issues). diagram.caption: Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud with the OpenShift AI add-on

diagrams.description:
This architecture illustrates the deployment of a GPU-enabled Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud with the OpenShift AI add-on, showcasing the key and optional components and their interactions for AI workload support. The deployment leverages the Red Hat OpenShift Cluster Deployable Architecture, which is required to create and configure the cluster. In this cluster, the OpenShift AI add-on will be installed. A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) Deployable Architecture can be enabled to deploy the OpenShift AI cluster in a secure and isolated network environment. Users have the flexibility to either create a new VPC or use an existing one for the cluster deployment.

Optional resources include:

- Storage integration: Allows OpenShift AI workloads to efficiently manage large datasets and store logs.
- Observability resources: Enable logging, monitoring, and activity tracker event routing to enhance visibility and operational insights.
- Key Management Services (KMS): Configure key rings and keys for encryption. If KMS encryption is enabled, either Hyper Protect Services or Key Protect is used for encryption.
- Secrets Manager (SM): Stores and manages service credentials securely.
